newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: DSM raises stake in Alpha Drug to 51 pct.
newsitem.headline: DSM raises stake in Alpha Drug to 51 pct.

text.p: Dutch chemicals group DSM NV said on Friday its unit DSM Fine Chemicals had raised its stake in Alpha Drug India from 14 to 51 percent.
Alpha Drug produces semi-manufactures for semi-synthetic antibiotics.

"The upping of the stake in Alpha Drug fits with the strategy of DSM Fine Chemicals, which is among others aimed at strenghtening the worldwide leading positions in antibiotic side-chains," DSM said on a statement.
No financial details of the deal were disclosed.
DSM said the step strengthened its worldwide production basis, and enabled it to increase the service offered to customers.
Some 20 percent of all antibiotics are sold to India, DSM said, adding the market in important semi-synthetic antibiotics grew by two to 10 percent in the country.
